name: Sheraton Suites Tampa Airport Westshore

reviews.text: My family and I just spent two nights at the Sheraton Suites Tampa. While I got an excellent rate through Priceline, I had the most terrible night I have ever had in a hotel. The hotel apparently has very poor sound insulation between floors. The inconsiderate people in the room above us were constantly moving furniture across the floor (at least that is what it sounded like) which made a terribly loud sound in our room keeping us from getting any sleep until after 4:30 am (even my ear plugs would not allow me to get to sleep). After 3 trips to the front desk to complain, at 4 am the Tampa police was finally called to remove the large group of people from the room (I was told over 10) but they still allowed the couple who rented the room to remain. There were at least 2 other rooms who were also complaining about this party room. It should not have taken over 4 hours to solve this problem. Hotel management should have removed these people after their first warning (around midnight). Waiting until 4 am to do anything to solve the problem only lost them good customers who were "playing by the rules" of decency.
reviews.title: Terribly Noisy Night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I talked to the am front desk manager and insisted on a refund. This solution should have been the hotel's immediate offer and it should have included BOTH nights of my stay. I told her of the poor sound insulation which she denied was the problem. I also told her that it shouldn't have taken so long to call the police. The night manager and the morning manager told me completed different stories on the timeline of their actions.
reviews.title: CLEAN, FRIENDLY, AFFORDABLE

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I insisted that we be moved for our final night of stay (another inconvenience for us) and the hotel did move us to the top floor (that way no one was above us). Street noise is very apparent from both rooms we stayed in.
reviews.title: Stunning Atrium

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are many hotels in the Westshore area to choose from. I was very disappointed with the treatment from a Sheraton property (a 3-1/2 star??). It looks dated and needs an upgrade. Stay away from this hotel and choose one of the others.
reviews.title: Great location, good value

reviews.text: We have stayed in the Sheraton Suites 6 times in the last 3 months as we are using a medical facility in the vicinity periodically. The Hotel is much more convenient and easier than driving the hour home after procedures. The hotel is perfect for our situation. The bedroom is separated from the living area with a door so my spouse can be resting while I have access to the rest of the living area with easy chair, couch, TV, large desk, microware and refrigerator. There are large TV’s in both rooms. We have stayed in both the East and West wings toward the front and find it quiet and easy to get sleep.
reviews.title: definitely exceeded my expectations!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One elevator working, great view of a school bus parking lot, rooms beat up a bit, linens were fresh and clean. Shuttle is very convenient
reviews.title: Get what you pay for
Beautiful atrium; close to airport
reviews.text: For a 6 hour stay, adequate. any longer, try the renaissance...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here for a weekend and got a room on the 6th floor. Overall I enjoyed my stay. There was a wedding that weekend so there were a lot of festivities but I didn't hear any noise when I tried to sleep.
reviews.title: Great Airport Hotel/Best Restaurants nearby

reviews.text: The only con I had was the extra charges on my bill for bottled water ($8 total) after I had already left the property and checked out (upon checkout there were no extra charges.) I was perplexed since the bottled water in my room clearly stated it was complimentary. Thus I called the hotel again and a lady told me they would fix it. A week later it still wasn't fixed so I called again and got another lady who finally fixed the issue.
reviews.title: Great Employees and Very Nice Hotel

reviews.text: I'd stay here again though.
reviews.title: Avoid the pool and breakfast buffet, otherwise nice

reviews.text: I greatly anticipated this trip. It was important to my professional life - and a day on the beach was important to my wife's personal life. The hotel is VERY easy to find along I-275 (which apparently will be under construction for three more years), though to get on the expressway, you currently have to drive the opposite way from the hotel you wish to go (found that out the hard way the first day and ended up on a causeway in St. Petersburg FAR from where I needed to be). It is also very convenient to the airport, and is centrally located to just about anywhere I wanted or needed to be.
reviews.title: Rough around the edges - some badly overlooked items

reviews.text: It gives the appearance of previously being one of the hotels who makes their name with rooms outlining a gigantic atrium. And supposedly they have updated the hotel with a huge renovation. And some of the upgrades are notable.
reviews.title: Comfortable

reviews.text: Most of the staff seemed friendly, and were helpful in terms of letting you use things like luggage carts. But they seemed utterly stumped in terms of what to do when something obvious got overlooked. More on that later.
reviews.title: Great stay, wonderful staff!

reviews.text: Although they are full two-room suites, the bathrooms are ridiculously claustrophobic with very low water pressure. But at least the upgrades they have made with the shower curtain and head made it a bit more pleasant. And towels, when they provide them, are soft and large.
reviews.title: TRANQUILITY
Spacious suites with a nice interior
reviews.text: The room is very spacious with all the needed amenities except for a safe. It even included two free bottles of water. The lighting is surprisingly good in the rooms, even if finding each light's on/off switch is a bit of a challenge. There are also plenty of outlets, including on each light.

It's a beautiful hotel, the lobby is breath taking. The happy hour is great and the food in the restaurant is decent. The rooms are very comfy, spacious and clean. Most of the staff was very nice and made up for the couple of grumps along the way. I would and will definitely stay here again!
reviews.title: Loved it!!
Old and rude person at the Front
reviews.text: Second night in Tampa we stayed in this 3* hotel. We arriving very late in the evening - the lady at the front desk were very cold with our little children - like she doesnt like kids in the hotel. The room size was ok amd the room was clean (90%). The water in the shower was cold im the morning. I called the front desk to ask them if this is standart. She told me very rude you have to wait water have to be runing minimum 20 minutes to get warm. Nice think if 4 people are waiting to take a shower. At the check out the lady was very unfriendly. This was our last stay in a Sheraton. We can not recommand it. Franziska

This former Embassy Suites is showing its age. All the guest rooms overlook the atrium and I could hear many sounds from the lobby. The rooms are all suites which is nice if you're staying for a few nights or have a family. It was more than I needed for just the one night though. I got a coupon for a free drink and hors d'oeuvres in the lobby but the hors d'oeuvres weren't much more than a few veggie sticks and some crackers.
reviews.title: could use some work

reviews.text: I stayed here using starwood points. great redemption value.. The hotel is very clean, and the rooms are big. The staff are very friendly. Overall would definitely recommend staying here. As far as i could tell they charge for wifi..
reviews.title: Better than expected

reviews.text: My family and I were pleasantly surprised to have the chance to stay at Sheraton Suites in Tampa (Airport Westshore) last weekend! It was a perfect place for many different reasons; clean, comfortable, accessible to many different restaurants, the airport (without being noisy), golf courses, and shopping if you like that as well. We were so impressed with every single staff member who went out of their way to be helpful, friendly, and genuinely kind and attentive to all of their guests' needs. I am so grateful to them all and we will definitely be back there again soon. And having an extra room in the suite is perfect for families so you can really stretch out and relax on your trip (and comfy beds too). I felt lucky enough to experience an amazing workshop there onsite, but what a bonus to also have the chance to enjoy such a beautiful and comfortable hotel...With Much Gratitude!
reviews.title: Staff that goes ABOVE and BEYOND!!! Great place to stay in Tampa...

aka: Sheraton Suites Tampa Airport Westshore Hotel Tampa
description: The Sheraton Suites Tampa Airport Westshore is just a short complimentary shuttle ride from the airport. We are right in the middle of the Westshore business district, off Interstate 275.
